channel.title: Softwares on Gioele La Manno
channel.description: Recent content in Softwares on Gioele La Manno

item.title: Spotiflow
item.description: Spotiflow is a deep learning method for subpixel-accurate spot detection in fluorescence microscopy images. It formulates spot detection as a multiscale heatmap and stereographic flow regression problem, achieving state-of-the-art performance on diverse datasets while being robust to different noise conditions. Key features: - Subpixel-accurate 2D and 3D spot detection - Optimized for spatial transcriptomics workflows - Robust to low signal-to-noise ratio images - Available as Python library and napari plugin

item.title: uMAIA
item.description: uMAIA (unified Mass Imaging Analyzer) is an analytical framework for the joint analysis of large mass spectrometry imaging (MSI) datasets. It enables the construction of multidimensional metabolomic atlases by extracting, aligning, and normalizing data into coherent, accurate maps. Key features: - Joint analysis of large MSI datasets - Spatial lipidomics clustering and imputation - Differential analysis tools - 4D lipid mapping across developmental stages Find the GitHub repo here

item.title: VeloCycle
item.description: VeloCycle is a Bayesian model of RNA velocity that couples velocity field and manifold estimation in a unified framework, enabling formal statistical testing of gene expression dynamics. It fits an inferentially coherent model directly on raw data, eliminating heuristics that dominate current scRNA analyses. Key features: - Formal statistical testing of dynamics - End-to-end Bayesian inference - Cell cycle speed quantification - Manifold-constrained velocity estimation Find the GitHub repo here
